top_categories.workout_context: 435 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
52,493ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 435 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Torino Nice Rally's Paved alpine roads, Military gravel roads forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 435 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Torino Nice Rally's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
At Torino Nice Rally, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
435 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
52,493ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
121ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Torino Nice Rally, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 52,493ft of climbing on mixed Alpine terrain - paved cols, military does to your power file on race day.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on mixed Alpine terrain - paved cols, military. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.

race_overlay.heat: September in Turin, Italy to Nice, France can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Torino Nice Rally. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 435 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 435 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Torino Nice Rally with 52,493ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Torino Nice Rally demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed alpine terrain - paved cols, military gravel roads, rocky doubletrack at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: paved alpine roads, military gravel roads, rough doubletrack. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 435 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, VO2max, and Endurance to prepare you for 435 miles of mixed alpine terrain - paved cols, military gravel roads, rocky doubletrack in Turin, Italy to Nice, France.
